subject: p17340686
History: History of multiple medical problems with cough and possible pneumonia.
Findings: An opacity in the right infrahilar region on the PA image and overlying the spine on the lateral image is consistent with pneumonia. The previously seen opacity on the left has improved suggesting it was likely due to edema. A pulmonary edema is improved from the prior radiograph, although a small amount of edema remains. The cardiac silhouette is stably enlarged. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. A right internal jugular double-lumen hemodialysis catheter ends in the atrium.
Impression: Right infrahilar opacity is most likely pneumonia. Improving pulmonary edema.
